website_summaries.verdict: A well-priced option for a Mac-compatible hard drive with fast speed.
pros: USB 3.0 connection makes the performance suitable for large media files such as videos and photos
Comes with several different size options for the right fit
cons: The construction quality of the hard drive's exterior is not as high as more rugged options

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 35 days.
customer_reviews.text: Using this drive as a backup for my Mac Pro, tonight it unmounted from my computer & will not mount again. Unit has power, makes normal amount of noise trying to boot up, but will not mount on 2 different Macs. Tried different ports, cables, etc. And of course, this happens on the eve of a deadline in which I need to retrieve a file from this piece of garbage. Had the foresight to buy a protection plan, so we'll see if my files can be retrieved once business hours resume. Sadly, this won't happen before my deadline so, thanks for nothing, Seagate. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephalopod

customer_reviews.title: Slow...
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Seagate Slim USB 3.0 drive that was very fast, about as fast as my fastest SSD pen drives. This one is 3x slower :-( My test was on running an image backup on my laptop. Using any fast USB/SSD drive, the backup runs in about 25 mins. With this drive it takes about 80 mins... Yikes!
customer_reviews.author: Zitty

customer_reviews.title: Avoid! Avoid! Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! I purchased the Seagate drive just over 6 weeks ago. Yesterday my computer suddenly stopped recognizing it. No clicking noises or warning whatsoever. I called Seagate and had a lengthy conversation. Their solution is spending $699 to recover the data!!! $49 non refundable just to "look" at the drive and then $650 to recover the data. And then they offered to send any (if at all) recovered data back on a 4TB drive. Apparently the 2 year warranty is worthless. I now notice all the other 1 star reviews. I hope you take heed too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a single 5TB HDD.
customer_reviews.text: Item is advertised as a "5 TB Mechanical Hard Disk". This is incorrect. Based on size; this item it appears to be "two 2.5 TB Mechanical Hard Disks" in some kind of RAID. That means there is likely a higher chance of failure than a single 2.5 TB HDD. I do not wish to void my warranty by opening this item. Can Seagate confirm the dual drive setup of this item, state which RAID configuration, and correct their item description?
customer_reviews.author: ShamWow

customer_reviews.title: PS4 SYS. & Extende
customer_reviews.text: This is a grate drive for extended storange for the PS4 & is also great for system backup on the PS4 after ya reformat to FAT32. PLUG AND PLAY. I HAVE 2 OF THEN. If ya don't want to loose what ya have & save ya time & money to keep what ya paid for. Time tested for 2 years. Vary happy.
customer_reviews.author: LAB TECH TESTING

customer_reviews.title: bad sector!
customer_reviews.text: bought this one to back up my data. After writing about 3TB i start seeing Windows complaining, so I ran a surface scan and saw a block of bad sector. I am returning this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: WORTHLESS product support by Seagate
customer_reviews.text: Software does not even recognize another Seagate drive as a source for backup. Seagate Product "Support" ignores information provided - responds with canned text. At least the drive reads & writes...
customer_reviews.author: lucyloo

customer_reviews.title: Seagate drive is the best and also the best customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Wester Digital drive and the drive went out in 31 days and Western Digital would not provide a replacement without me returning the one that went bad and was full of personal and sensitive information. They ran me around in a circle for 2 weeks then decide not to replace the item. I offered to pay a fee to keep and destroy the old one. I bought a 5TB Seagate for less money from Amazon and got it the same day. I have had one for 10 years and got this one because of the 5TB storage. No more Wester Digital.
customer_reviews.author: fjohnsocal

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine, Though a Little Noisy
customer_reviews.text: The drive works fine and installed easily as my Time Machine backup drive for Mac OS. Has been working fine for about a month now with no issues. I didn't use any of the included setup software. I just plugged it in, formatted it, and was on my way. However, I can definitely hear it spinning--a constant low-level whine/hum here on my desk. It's not terribly loud, but definitely audible. I guess I've just become so used to the silence of SSD's that I forgot what spinning, disk-based drives sounded like. So, that's the only reason I deducted 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: The Guitar Answer Guy

customer_reviews.title: I HATE this Seagate Backup Plus
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting an external backup drive but I am not sure what it is. I thought it was Plug and Play but instead, pages of instructions show up and nothing I choose moves me along. I have spent hours trying to figure this out. And I am so angry and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cris R.

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after one month!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the external drive that my computer would no longer accept after upgrading to Catalina. I transferred all my files (4TB) and all was well until I tried to access files on it. It had somehow unmounted itself and would not remount. It wouldn't repair. I had just put hundreds of newly scanned family pictures that go back to 1980 on the drive. I am paying a technician big bucks to recover my files for me. Won't buy another Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Frahme

customer_reviews.title: FRUSTRATING AND ULTIMATELY USELESS
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in good condition and seems to work, but my Windows 10 HP computer does not recognize it. I wasted over 4 hours trying to get this thing set up and got nowhere. I'm tired, frustrated, and angry. The tiny pamphlet that supposedly includes installation instructions is USELESS. I went to the Seagate website and it is similarly useless. I searched U-Tube videos, found some that seem to be relevant, but still cannot make it work. I'm returning it, although what I would really like to do is run it through a wood chipper. If you are not a computer programmer, and do not want to pay some kid to try to figure this thing out, DON'T BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Guerbo

customer_reviews.title: I must have got a dud
customer_reviews.text: I've had excellent luck with these Seagate drives. I ordered this one and it worked fine for a week or so then it was no longer being recognized by any computer I plugged it into. I was still in the return window so I decided to return it for a refund and bought another similar Seagate drive at a local brick and mortar store. I still like Seagate but sometimes you get a bad product from any company once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: B. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Works great as my Time Machine backup disk
customer_reviews.text: My network attached storage devices both died within a month of each other. Rather than spending the money for a new network attached device, I bought this Seagate 2tb Backup Plus. Set up for use as a Time Machine backup disk is not as simple as “plug and play”. But it was pretty easy and worked like a charm. The set up instructions say that it has to be reformatted for use with Time Machine but that happens automatically when you map it as your backup disk. Added benefit - having the drive connected directly to my MacBook makes the backup process run much faster than when I was backing up to a network storage device.
customer_reviews.author: gmo

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on Mac Book Pro with Catalina O/S
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wasted 4 hours trying to get the drive to work. The end result, it didn't. The Tech support video was not even close to the actual screens on my MBP running Catalina O/S. I would not purchase again, I do not recommend. 1/2020
customer_reviews.author: VIPER

customer_reviews.title: SEAGATE MAKES GREAT STUFF
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, and with no issues. This was just "plug it in and go." My only issue was that there was extraneous crap on the drive that I could not remove, so I only got 3.63TB of storage! Seagate, stop putting extra crap on these drives. I paid for 4TB, I want 4 TB! But it works perfectly. I did a massive data transfer (1.6TB) at midnight and upon waking at 7:30AM it was complete. Ill be buying Seagate devices again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Fast reliable and a good price
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this in to an HP ML370 G6 using a third party USB 3.0 card. Once the partitions were deleted Server 2016 was able to see the drive and use it as a dedicated backup target. It is fast and reliable. I like these drives as ‘rotatable’ backups.
customer_reviews.author: firewallbillTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed when it arrived. (Not DOA)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and a WD 4tb for portable storage. The Seagate failed after first use, and would not show correct size. Upon further inspectoin, and more reveiws of this many people had this issue. I tried It on 6 different systems, I do not recommend this portable drive to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy
customer_reviews.text: Windows 10 cant find the drive I went to there site and downloaded software that was supposed to fix that but still not able to locate the device also if its plugged in while trying to restart or power on your computer just wont turn on or restart properly. As a last ditch effort I tried using it on my xbox one x and once again the device isn't found anywhere. Waisted an hour trying to get this to work with no success.
customer_reviews.author: cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2013 MacBook Air!
customer_reviews.text: Seagate's external 1TB Backup Plus Slim Portable Hard Drive works great with 2013 Macbook Air, running Mac OS High Sierra 10.13.6. I just plugged it into the usb drive and it immediately showed up under the drive list. I did not need to reformat it. However, when I used it for the Time Machine back-up, a request to erase the drive popped up on the screen; stating the drive had incompatible files. I clicked "erase" and in two seconds the hard drive was ready to use with the Time Machine. No issues occurred. This drive comes with it's own usb cord. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Learning I Cant purchase many items as gifts and definitely not in advance! If broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift. Then learn the time is expired to ask for exchange!! I suggest don’t ever buy gifts ahead of time! If it’s more than the 30 days the warranty is expired! So I spent my money on a great hard drive that won’t download photos! Nope just won’t work correctly and a gift is broken!!! I’m so upset and it’s pathetically embarrassing to say here a broken gift! Now no exchanges after 30 days. If customer service decides to trade this broken one for a working one... I’d be ever so grateful! I’d even change our review if we received one that really works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anji M.

customer_reviews.title: So. So. Slow
customer_reviews.text: The price was right, so I figured I'd pick up a second backup drive. To cut things short: too slow. With my 2-year old drive I copy files at slightly over 100MBS, and with this (using the same cable, same port, same computer) the average is 17MBS, or about 600% slower. As for the looks: meh. The tinted brushed aluminum is pretty nice, but the plastic casing is very cheap. Not a major consideration, but something to note. Bottom line: I do not recommend this drive. Will either keep it as a back up to my back up or return it and get a drive that actually works, as this is a speed which is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: G.M.

customer_reviews.title: very low transfer rate
customer_reviews.text: I formatted this drive to ntfs, then began copying data from another drive. The data rate was in the 100k range. I have another seagate 2T drive ( a different model ) that transfers fine at 5M rate. The low transfer rate makes the drive completely unusable for me. I do not know if the drive was defective in some way, but regardless, I will have to search for a different product from a different manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: Jack Richards

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it to work, only shows 59gb not 5 terabytes, Amazon Customer Service NO help
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this external hard drive to combine files from desktop, laptop and tablet onto one device. Tried to use it and it only showed 59gb. I called Amazon and customer service kept talking in circles saying I'd missed the return deadline but I didn't even get the item until after the return window had closed (something they seemed to not "hear"). Amazon said I should contact Seagate for a warranty but having only used the device for the first time, it seemed ridiculous to contact Seagate for a warranty for a BRAND NEW item. Then COVID started and I'm out of $100 bucks for a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: CNMI Prime

customer_reviews.title: Very slow write speeds due to SMR technology
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit dissapointed with this 5TB hard drive. While the price is attractive, the technology they use is the SMR technology that is very slow compare to traditional CMR technology. If you only write small amounts of data at one time, you will probably not notice it too much, but who buys a 5TB drive to only write small amounts of data? When copying large amounts of data, you will only be able to see write speeds of around 60MBps which is half of what older CMR technology drives do. Together with the thicker 15mm size, making it comparably less portable than 9.5mm drives, I am not sure this is such a good deal anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tomgadgets

customer_reviews.title: Slow, SMR
customer_reviews.text: It's okay if you need some temporary capacity for a few files, which is what I bought it for. Almost throw-away, as I don't find Seagate drives very reliable. Boy is it slow. USB 3.0, but sustained write speeds topping out at maybe 60MB/s. Didn't use or not interested in the software. Comes formatted with a very small VFAT partition and then a large exFAT partition. Why? Beats me.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Davis

customer_reviews.title: Software doesn't work great - EDIT: Harddrive went belly up after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The backup software has a lot of issues, mainly every time it backs up it creates a new archive. It's supposed to only update the new files and files that have changed. Fail. The hardware works well though, therefor the 3 stars. edit: Hard drive started crashing the computer, one I removed it the problem was fixed. Filled out RMA info and even though it's been 2 months they want ME to pay shipping... My advice, go Western Digital. edit edit: After rma they sent me a new brand new HD. I'm having issues transferring at usb3.0 speed but I'm not sure yet the reason.
customer_reviews.author: badseed01

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and I know nothing about Tech
customer_reviews.text: My MacBook was getting a wee bit full and I know nothing about tech other then googling and asking around as to what to do. I use my computer primarily for school and work so to be clear I don't have large files or professional grade programs to export. That's why I liked this external hard drive, it made it easy to just plug in, download software, and sync with Time Machine on the computer. I did have to ask around for one of the best brands and everyone recommended SeaGate and I'm happy I went with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jhordan Blumenberg

customer_reviews.title: Speed and Very Good Storage
customer_reviews.text: I own several external hard drives and out of all of them only the Seagate ones have been trouble-free. They just work and keep on working. I have small form factor (2-1/2") portable USB hard drives in sizes from 1 TB to 4 TB, and they've all given trouble free service. I love to have seagate hard drives. Also i would recommend my friends to go for seagate hard drives. It is different from other storage drives, as the speed of the drive is very unique when we compare with other drives. We can purchase with amazon anytime as it is available for all the users with good price.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik

customer_reviews.title: failed within a week
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this as a separate hard drive to store photos, old documents, etc. But the proprietary software won't let me. It only allows backups, not transfers, keeps giving me error messages, hardware failure. Tech support is a link to web pages, basically worthless. I suppose if you want a continuous backup of current work, this would be fine. But it's useless as an external hard drive. Wish I hadn't bought it. Too late to return it. Don't make my mistake. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The 4TB drive did not work with Time Machine on my late 2015 iMac
customer_reviews.text: I got both a 4TB drive for my iMac (late 2015) and a 2TB drive for my MacBook Air. Could not get the 4TB drive to work. When I tried to format the 4TB drive to work with Time Machine I got some type of disk error and from that point it would not mount on any of my computers. Returned the 4TB drive and got another 4TB drive and the same thing happened. I had no problems with the 2TB drive. So beware of the 4TB drive!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry A Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 month plus 8 days
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this a month ago (plus 8 days, so I can't return it) and although it whirrs when I plug it in, it doesn't show up on any of my 3 computers -- 2 desktops and a laptop. This is insane. I would never buy a Seagate External HD again!
customer_reviews.author: G. Galanti

customer_reviews.title: Hate the micro USB connector.
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike the fact that this comes with a short cable with a crazy connector on the drive side. Why not USB C? I'm really unhappy. I have a nice new laptop with high speed USB C ports and this thing has a connector that seems like a big step backward. It's going back for a refund and I'll get one with USB C connector.
customer_reviews.author: D Bruton

customer_reviews.title: Does What It's Supposed to Do
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to back up a ton of image files and so far it's working perfectly. The interface I found quirky, but finally figured it out. I gave a three for tech support only because I haven't used it. I doubt I'll be porting this anywhere, but, if I were, it's exceedingly compact and the fact that it runs off USB power is a huge plus. Overall, great purchase at an amazing price..
customer_reviews.author: jc norton

customer_reviews.title: Had so many problems with this drive and Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: This drive worked fine on some older machines but was horrible on others. It would not be detected on some Win 7 64bit machines and yet others it worked fine. It did work on the one Windows 10 machine I tried it on so I guess if all your machines are Windows 10 you should be fine. I am not sure why this would make a difference as all my other passport drives work on all my machines. The drive itself is fast when it does work and not loud at all.
customer_reviews.author: RobbygTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in, found the Windows 10 built in full back up feature (buried in the backup facility under Windows 7 to get the full back up feature), and let it get on with it. Never did get the lightroom feature to work - forget why but think it had something to do with giving a credit card and having to cancel to make it a free trial.
customer_reviews.author: fanojag

customer_reviews.title: Not the best external hard drive....not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the external HDD last black Friday, great deal 89.99. But...... At first, it seemed to work fine, it came with one exFAT partition, macOS recognized the partition, but I could not eject the disk, so I reformatted, then the problems started. I made 3 partitions, one exFAT, one ext4 and one for Mac. Nowadays just one of the 3 partitions is recognizable OSX, one in windows. My fix: Low-level format again and 4 TB of data transfer. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Never Could Get It to Work!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several times to get this to work. I even went on the Seagate site to try and download the driver thinking maybe that was the issue. The site did nit recognize the s/n and I could not get the driver for it. It's basically a brick or a paper weight at this point. Sad too. I needed a good hard drive with lots of storage. This one? Waste of money and effort.
customer_reviews.author: TWR_FLWR

customer_reviews.title: Great back up drive and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use this to backup our photos. About 2.5 TB of them. Other than this support it also allows other family members to use it as portable drive when they need to search for a photo they want. Only a short connection to power and connect it to a computer. Size of a pack of cards. A usb 3 connection so fast as you will get. Very useful to us.
customer_reviews.author: C. Strain

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Bought this to replace a unit that was making noises and giving the impression it was going bad. Having previously lost data due to not paying attention to these little signals, I purchased this Seagate and quickly transferred everything to this new unit. The transfer time was quick – – much quicker than two other units I currently use for backing up data. At minimum, there’s peace of mind when your data may be transferred quickly and reliably to a new unit made by a well-known company like Seagate. Love the red color, too!
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: 2 birds, 1 stone
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new imac with a 256gb drive.. my nas drive just doesn't have enough space to do a time machine backup.. I also needed photoshop on my new mac cause I have an event in 3 weeks. so the included 2 months of 'photography' that includes photoshop is perfect. JUST MAKE SURE you register your drive with the application on the drive, before you reformat for mac. Process was painless for adobe, but I suggest creating an account prior. It is silence, and compact. I only plan to plug it in once a week for backups. I would order again
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: lasted 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: 5 weeks on and it is dead.... cannot do anything with it, can't format or anything at all...Naturally one week past return by date... no more for me...
customer_reviews.author: Annette Thomas

customer_reviews.title: uses to many amps for reliable usb use, no external power option.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like its operating outside of USB 3.0 specs, it works fine on my desktop usb 3.0 ports, but doesn't work on my laptops 3.0 ports. going to try a usb C cable on my laptop to see if that works since it puts out more amps. no option for an external power supply which sucks.
customer_reviews.author: 26oo

customer_reviews.title: HD arrived the same day I ordered it
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to receive the Hard Drive earlier than anticipated. I placed the order and it arrived the same day at 7PM. Right away I opened the packaged in great condition, and I formatted to APFS (Encrypted). I partitioned it in two, one at 3TB for back up for Time Machine, and the other 2TB for storage with the same format. Started to backup 450GB and it took a few hours for the first time. It finished it with no issues and I can save files on the second partition. In conclusion, from my point of view is great HD for my needs and plenty of storage capacity. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kagbeni

customer_reviews.title: My other seagate external hard drive quit working.
customer_reviews.text: I left my old one plugged in all the time in a secure location. One day it was dead. Bought this one to replace it and backed up my computer right away. Fast shipping. I plan to put this one away, then bring out once every two weeks to a month and back up the computer. Just have to be careful when handling it that I do not drop it. Hope it last longer by not having plugged in all the time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've not had good luck with Seagate drives. So far, this one has functioned well. It's not the immediate functionality that has been a problem. It's the longevity that has failed miserably. I've had 3 previous Seagate drives like this and each has failed shortly after their warranty ran out. I'm gambling on this one because I have a larger Western Digital drive that I am using to back up this one. And I'm backing it up very regularly. Only time and the warranty expiration date will tell if this drive was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great portable hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I love the Seagate Backup Plus 4TB External Hard Drive, it is compact, has tons of storage and doesn't need a separate power supply, which is always nice. I have backed up work files and personal files and still have more than 3TB free!
customer_reviews.author: L. DeMaio

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Backup Plus Slim 2TB External Hard Drive Portable HDD
customer_reviews.text: I have spent my career in data storage and when it comes to choosing storage for my personal use, Seagate is my top choice. The Seagate products are high quality, reliable and rugged (I definitely put my storage to the test). This is a product that I can feel good about recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Bones

customer_reviews.title: ok but...
customer_reviews.text: Kept disconnecting, computer could not find. Had to give to my son who works and computers and had to reset it and remove the useless programs that were built into it.
customer_reviews.author: DShifter

customer_reviews.title: Bad luck with this one....
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for capacity and price. Seemed good and then would not mount after 2 months of basic backup use. Tried on two different Macs, same result, would not mount. Ran first aid, nothing. Then disk repair and could not be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: tj303

customer_reviews.title: Device failed to install on 2 different computers.
customer_reviews.text: DO not buy this. It is not worth it. The usb cord didn't work right, and I even switched it out thinking that was it. Nope. The driver installed but the device failed. On 2 computers. I know thankfully it wasn't my computer doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rose

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Constantly connects, disconnects from my computer, Windows eternally says "there is a problem with this drive" etc. Have tried connecting it directly to a USB 3.0 port, and my hub, doesn't matter. Also, the proprietary cord is too short, which is extremely aggravating and has no workaround.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Got One For My Mac
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get one for my Mac. On the picture, the blue one is my newest purchase, as the silver one I purchased since 2015 and it still reads and preforms normally. Another bonus was that you get the Photography Plan for two months so I wanted to take advantage of it since I use the software daily. It's a bummer for me because I thought it was going to be on a seperate card / paper... turns out it was preloaded into the drive. In which, I formatted the first thing I done when plugging it in. Totally my fault, but it isn't a dealbreaker for me. That extra storage counts.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rice

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the PS4
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and good volume. Plugged it in and formatted on the PS4. Took about a minute or two and done. Excellent choice for the purpose. It’s basically the exact same drive as the game drive, but isn’t pre-formatted. Really pleased with this drive. Light and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Bugsy

customer_reviews.title: Great price for the space, but I’m seeing errors.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for the storage but I’m getting corruption errors as of day 2. Every time I use the drive, no matter which computer I use it on, I get an error saying the drive needs to be repaired. I have multiple 500GB portable drives that don’t have that issue. I’ll give it more time and provide updates.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kovacic

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive strictly for backups. It has enough room to create and store multiple system images quickly and easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slower than expected for Macbook Time Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Macbook Pro Time Machine backup. It works fine with time Machine. After plugged in Mac automatically starts to back up. It's just that it takes for ever to complete a backup. 12 hours?... I had this machine for only a few months and I don't even have any game installed. Its way slower than I expected...
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My Ps4 finally has sooo much storage! I can't afford a lot of games but all the free games I get from PSN I can store in here
customer_reviews.author: Asht

customer_reviews.title: Had a problem
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with the USB drive. After 3 weeks lost all the data. Don't know why, it was working great. Called customer service and explained what had taken place. Not only did they replace the USB, But amazon sent me my replacement USB drive without waiting to received the defective one. Now, not everyone does that. Sent the defective one and downtime wasn't felt. thank You Julio
customer_reviews.author: Julio Morales

customer_reviews.title: Just want a hard drive that works
customer_reviews.text: Got all of two months of use before the stupid thing had a power failure and now there's nothing I can do but spend hundreds to recover recently made and unbacked up files. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects Repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for many years, but this model will not hold a cord or maintain a connection. The risk of data loss is too great. The original white cord was never quit snug enough and repeatedly came loose until I secured the drive with Velcro. When it became necessary to use the drive portably, it was no longer feasible to use the Velcro, and I had to deal with the wobbly cable several times per day. I replaced the cable with a sturdier, more expensive one that fit very snugly, but to my surprise, it made no difference. It disconnects at random while in use. I've had to order a new model. Money down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Firestarter

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I was searching around for a decent external hard drive to give to my nephew. He has a Macbook Pro, with limited internal storage, and is making music that takes up a lot of space. This was a great value for the amount of storage space that it provides. The size is great as well, as it does not take up too much room, and allows him to be mobile with his laptop. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for PS4
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Small and compact. This is the second one I have ordered. The first was for pc backup/storage and this one was for ps4. It formatted perfectly for the ps4 and has been working great. Have had this one for a few months plugged into the ps4 and gets used daily. The pc one I have had for a few years and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on any computer and also disabled my wireless mouse when plugged in. Tried to use their tech support and that didn't work either.
customer_reviews.author: JW348

customer_reviews.title: Not as high quality as you'd expect.
customer_reviews.text: 1) It does not include an encryption software and if it does they don't make it easy to do. For the price I'd expect an encryption software. 2) It feels cheap, the photos almost make it look high quality but don't be fooled. its plastic. Thin plastic. when you're backing up to the drive you can hear it vibrate thru the cheap plastic. I would have expected better quality from a company like seagate. Next time will buy a different external drive. I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Harriman

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller replacement for my previous external drive
customer_reviews.text: and it has twice the capacity. I also like that it's powered only by the USB connection and doesn't need a separate electrical connection. With a USB 3 plug it is also much faster than my previous external drive, also from Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: BillS

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Love the color...drive does what it's supposed to do without any fuss. Tons of storage on the go if needed. I'm getting about 138 Mb/s read, 132 Mb/s write which is a little above average for spinning external HDDs. Great purchase, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Troy L.

customer_reviews.title: Unusable mouse
customer_reviews.text: This rechargeable BT mouse worked 1 month Ok, but after that, it started to show problems and now after 2 months it is almost unusable. It produces 2-3 clicks most of the time when you click once. It would be OK mouse if it worked. I have to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: Pertti Pietarinen

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival, poor tech support
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival, the drive does not mount at all either on the Mac desktop or in Apple’s Disk Utility. I tried two different Macs and two different cables. Instead of immediately returning through Amazon, I contacted their technical support, telling them that the drive would not mount at all. They suggested that I use Disk First Aid, but you can't run DFA on a drive that fails to mount! I then realized I could return through Amazon. Such a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Farm

customer_reviews.title: NOT a true portable drive
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a true portable drive. It has a mechanical disk like it's 2005. Extremely disappointed by every single review saying this is reliable. NO moving disks are reliable while portable. Returning. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to read/write home about, but it does the job. I don't know why Amazon would suggest stars for capacity. It states the capacity in the description, so... I bought for a college course involving Virtual Machines, but after the class is over I might repurpose for temporary storage as I reorganize our family's computers and create networked backup plans.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hulliberger

customer_reviews.title: Works on (my) Xbox One X
customer_reviews.text: I got it because it's $30 cheaper than the Xbox imprinted version, and I like it. I had trouble with initial set up, since you need to put it in a specific SS USB slot, but otherwise it's fine. For those who are plugging it into their Xbox, just know that you have to plug it in and perform connection setup while it's on. Count to ten, and if nothing has popped up by then, it's in the wrong SS port. Minus a star only for setup, but otherwise it's been doing it's job just fine, and I'm satisfied with that.
customer_reviews.author: Another Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So this is like the backup to the back of the back up backup which is backed up by others drives still. Having quite a collection of 'stuff' from over the years....decades actually...and after having lost much of my older collections I've become like a crazed survivalist when it comes to data backup. You never expect it to happen....but it will....Murphy says so.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas I.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Mac and PC
customer_reviews.text: I was able to save old photos on my macbook and then review them on my pc. Worked great
customer_reviews.author: ntd19

customer_reviews.title: Mine was Faulty but I wouldn’t say not to but this
customer_reviews.text: Obviously there are larger storage options. While I can say that this is a great option for portability, for some reason it ejects from my pc constantly. I don’t have this issue with any of my other hard drives or equipment. However, it could just be the one that I have.
customer_reviews.author: SixColourz

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this hard drive. This is the second HD I've bought to use for a xbox one, and both have failed and absolutely quit working after a month. I do not recommend this product whatsoever. In fact I will never buy from this company again. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Shops For Everything Online

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Seagate before and this one I honestly just bought for the color. I have other ones that I have used for photos and videos and they have been great. So this one was just another small 1 TB one I am getting. Ill be using it for videos as well. Also very easy to travel with if needed. the 1 Tb one is nice and slim, so it is easy to place in a backpack or a small bag.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Keep a Backup That Is Unplugged When You Want Data Safety
customer_reviews.text: The drive plugs in and you can start right away. You can unplug the drive and keep the data isolated. Easy, fast and convenient. Getting a new computer? Get a seperate before you begin. Reasonable price and reasonable delivery of product.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Wallbight

customer_reviews.title: Only worked once
customer_reviews.text: I bought this storage drive to back up files, however this drive only lasted once. I tried starting it up, and i kept getting the error that the drive doesn’t exist. I’d advise you spend your money elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: RunRaeRae

customer_reviews.title: Find a better brand!
customer_reviews.text: My son has had nothing but trouble with this hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Masters

customer_reviews.title: Great for ps4 when you are tired of deleting games to add new ones
customer_reviews.text: Great for ps4 just went to settings after plugging it in the usb on my ps4 went to device and reformatted it was done in less than 2 minutes and now I have all my games downloaded and will not need to delete them anymore to upload a new game I buy
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Michelle Amburgey

customer_reviews.title: It's so TINY!
customer_reviews.text: So I have 3 other hard drives in the house, and I needed another one. I figured this sucker would be solid, especially since it's a Seagate. I got it, decently sized box as I figured, and then I open the sucker and... It's so small! Width is about half that of the other 3 I have, and it's so much lighter! I wish all of them were this tiny!
customer_reviews.author: BlackBiblio

customer_reviews.title: I got a great deal on this 2TB 3.0 USB HDD
customer_reviews.text: I got a great deal on this 2TB 3.0 USB HDD and when being used on my laptop's 3.0 USB port it's noticeably faster. Now I've used it to make a backup of my files. I will buy another one to make a backup of that backup & be set. Color is nice to. You can color code your drives according to content type or importance or so on...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller, thinner, drives. Blue is classy light blue. Work great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 to replace a 2012 external drive when I bought a new PC with win10. All 3 drives work great. Bought all in blue. Very nice. They are light & thinner than last one. I did need to buy longer cables for them. The cable that cam with them is really short. Made laptop use but not for a desktop PC setup.
customer_reviews.author: dls74447

customer_reviews.title: Takes a licking, keeps on "ticking."
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this drive with me on my travels, over the past year. One time, I dropped the drive on an airport floor, and was surprized that it came back to life, unscathed. The drive holds many photographs, videos, and other high-capacity storage items. I can stream directly from the drive to my computer easily, for any format or use.
customer_reviews.author: Mohabee Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I got this as scratch space to record Blu-ray and UHD backups to before transferring them to a file server. Due to the Summer heat I've been keeping the file server turned off and only bringing it up once a month to transfer the latest backups to. I've also got a HTPC and have been connecting this directly to that to watch movies. It's worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: RedOneStandingBy

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD HARD DRIVE...
customer_reviews.text: I love this hard drive. I bought the 4TB in red. Very fast and the way it looks is great as well. I used to buy Toshibas, until I purchased a 2TB that completely deleted all my files in a matter of a few months. I was told Seagate hard drives are real good, that's why I purchased it. I gave Tech Support two stars because I have not contacted Seagate for technical support so I can't give it a 5 star. Overall, very fast hard drive, very nice and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Providencia S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent storage and portability
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to my laptop/notebook information. I copy major folders and my complete "Documents" to the drive and use the fast power of the 3.0. Only thing is how much space Seagate uses on their hard drives but that's an industry requirement if you want one. Very pleased with performance and original cost.
customer_reviews.author: Herb J

customer_reviews.title: Seagate 5TB External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I was about to return my new Seagate 5TB External Hard Drive, but before I did, I had called Amazon for support and they connected right away with a rep from Seagate and because I am using both a Mac and Window, they were able to help me to configure my Seagate 5TB External Hard Drive to handle both. Thank you Amazon and tank you Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A lot of storage space
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Seagate and I continue to be satisfied. The storage space is unbelievable. I will always purchase Seagate and recommend it to other customers.
customer_reviews.author: Lvnlocs4life

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Western Digital external hard drive that died after six months. This Seagate had good reviews, on amazon and outside amazon as well. It’s working great right out of the box. I use it for storage for my Tablo Lite DVR. The Tablo recognized it and reformatted it as soon as I plugged it in. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Third time buyer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drive at a great price. This is the third one of these I have purchased and filled. The different colors allow me to color code my data by time frame.
customer_reviews.author: mad scientist

customer_reviews.title: It's fast.
customer_reviews.text: I've had 6 of the 1TB Seagate backup drives for several years and only recently started to have issues with one of them - not the drive, but rather the plug from so much use. Rather than fool with the plug, I purchased a new 2TB drive. As with the others, it's simple plug n play ..... and it's fast!
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Schecter

customer_reviews.title: Second Seagate failure
customer_reviews.text: Put less than 7 gigabytes of data on it erased of where I was from then drive failed , all transferred unretrievable lost data would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bad cable
customer_reviews.text: I got this in December, used it once or twice, then found that the cable was faulty. I asked customer assistance for a replacement cable, but was told the cable warranty is only for three months, and I'm just outside the window. Pretty shoddy merchandise that it would die in such a short amount of time, with virtually no use.
customer_reviews.author: PKG

customer_reviews.title: Easy back up for my laptop!
customer_reviews.text: I panicked when I found my MAC backup drive dead. I had used the backup once to restore my laptop. So a new backup drive was an instant must. My sister had an external Seagate drive, so I went looking. Found this in a beautiful red and fell in love. So easy to plug in every time I start up my laptop and know that my Backup system is working beautifully again.
customer_reviews.author: Spy Kid

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HARD DRIVE!
customer_reviews.text: 2TB Metallic Steel Blue and white. Instantly worked with my Xbox one, very fast transfer speed! Fit all my games and still have 1.4TB left over for more games! Excellent item for a great price! Never have to uninstall a game again! I highly recommend for console users! If I ever run out of space I will definately buy another one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Blume

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Seagate Backup Plus drive. First one is still in use after several years on an earlier computer. I've never had any issues or problems with either.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce L. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nice 5TB HD
customer_reviews.text: Yet another winner from Seagate (at least in initial use). Everything worked. USB 3 files transfers were speedy. Note drives were formated exFAT. I use for system backup & offsite storage & the 5TB drive fits better than the 4, which I also have. Did not use the added software so no opnion on it.
customer_reviews.author: john l pellet

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and great value
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1) The appearance is good. I loved the red. Overall make is sturdy and attractive. 2) Storage is within an acceptable range. It was very close to 1 TB. 3) It has been reliable so far. We have been using frequently to transfer data from one computer to another. We haven't encountered any problem. Cons: 1) Write speed is moderate. Go for SSD if you are looking for faster write speed.
customer_reviews.author: BussAcct23

product_meta.title: Seagate STHN2000400 Backup Plus Slim 2TB External Hard Drive Portable HDD - Black USB 3.0 for PC Laptop and Mac, 1 Year Mylio Create, 2 Months Adobe CC Photography
product_meta.description: Capacity:2TB| Color:BlackStore and access 2TB of photos and files on the go, with Seagate Backup Plus Slim. The perfect compliment to personal aesthetic, this compact, portable external hard drive features a minimalist brushed metal enclosure and quick plug and play connectivity with the included USB 3.0 cable. Giving files extra protection is practically effortless—simply back up with a single click or schedule automatic daily, weekly, or monthly backups. Plus—edit, manage, and share photos with a one year complimentary subscription to Mylio Create and a two month membership to Adobe Creative Cloud Photography Plan.
feature_bullets: Store and access 2TB of photos and files on the go, with Seagate Backup Plus Slim, an external hard drive for Mac and Windows
This portable external hard drive features a minimalist brushed metal enclosure, and is a stylish USB drive

Simply plug this external hard drive for Mac and Windows into a computer via the included USB 3.0 cable to back up files with a single click or schedule automatic daily, weekly, or monthly backups; Reformatting may be required for use with Time Machine
Edit, manage, and share photos with a 1 year complimentary subscription to Mylio Create and a 2 month membership to Adobe Creative Cloud Photography Plan
Enjoy long term peace of mind with the included 2 year limited warranty

specifications.Series: Seagate 2TB Backup Plus Slim Portable Hard Drive
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars7,856 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
